alert.note: Alert for Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:36AM EST until December 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Danville affecting Montour, Northumberland, and Columbia Counties. For the Mainstem Susquehanna River...including Danville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Danville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Inundation begins in Riverside on the left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon, and crest just above 20 feet this afternoon and evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
